website_summaries.verdict: With this coffee maker you can brew your favorite cup of joe in a variety of sizes, one at a time. If this is how you prefer to make coffee, it's the one for you.
pros: A contemporary machine with the ability to brew single-serve cups
capacity reservoir and is compatible with single-serve coffee pods including K-Cups
Has a sleek stainless steel finish
cons: Coffee may spatter a bit during the brewing process, and it's somewhat noisy
A few reports of leaks from the reservoir

customer_reviews.title: Poor design, cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an earlier model of Cuisinart single serve coffee maker which served me so well for six or seven years, I would not have bought any other brand. This one felt cheap, like it was manufactured from thinner, flimsier plastic. I think the water pump pumps water faster than the k-cup can accommodate: coffee grounds spill out of the k-cup, getting into the coffee and making a mess of the k-cup slot. Meanwhile, the coffee doesn't just drip out of the spout, it runs along the horizontal surfaces like rain along a clogged gutter, dripping in front of and behind the cup. I am returning this piece of junk and not going back to Cuisinart for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: G. L. Munn

customer_reviews.title: Seems good value and works way better than my old Keurig ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had the SS-10 for about a week now. Seems good value and works way better than my old Keurig that had to be replaced about every year. I like the selection of cup sizes, especially 12 oz. My only con is if you expect Stainless Steel you are out of luck, it is plastic and pretty light weight. Overall it looks good and seems to be a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the cuisinart coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I have always used the keurig coffee maker. After my last one stopped working, thought I would try the cuisinart. So far I like it much better.
customer_reviews.author: Drennen Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Great Brewer
customer_reviews.text: Could not find many reviews so I was hesitant to buy the SS-10 but I trusted Cuisinart. I have only had it a week and I already like it way better then than the Keurig 2.0. The brewing is instant with he ss-10 you do not need to wait for the water to warm up, that is awesome. The coffee flavor is good. Having the basket to brew your own grinds is great. It is nice to have the basket stored in the brewer so it wont get lost when your not using it. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a kcup brewer.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as a Keurig
customer_reviews.text: I researched all the Keurigs to buy yet another replacement for my broken Keurig. Then I saw this one and good reviews and good price so I bought it. It is pretty much the same as the last Keurig we had - same types of settings and buttons, etc. It is mostly plastic on the outside, so it maybe seems a bit cheaper. It has a bigger water reservoir, which I like. And I really liked the price! The pod holder doesn’t tip outward like on Keurig’s, but it’s really no big deal. The coffee tastes a little stronger, also. All in all, I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: This is the best Single Serve coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this more than 5 stars I would! This is the best Single Serve coffee maker. The minute you turn it on the water is hot and the coffee is ready immediately. I hesitated on the price but, without a doubt, it is worth it. Has a rinse cycle if you want to rinse it after making something besides coffee, like hot chocolate, etc. We are absolutely thrilled with this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I had an earlier model of the coffee maker and ...
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier model of the coffee maker and it lasted for several years. My current coffee maker, just less than a year old , started pumping cold water when i filled the water tank. What is even more weird is the coffee maker is tuned off! When coffee maker ran out of water the pump kept running and i had to unplug it to make it stop. Up until now i would have given it a 5 star rating. I will post how cuisinart handles fixing my problem Update. Cuisnart stood behind their product and sent a replacement with no hassles . This is a good coffee maker and i would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Winston Smith 1984

customer_reviews.title: Descale not possible
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 6 months ago, two weeks ago the descale light came on, after 2 gallons of viniger, and more than $100 worth of descale solution including lime away the light is still on, NEVER BUY THIS ITEM ITS WORTHLESS, ill keep using it until it dies then ill switch back to kurig
customer_reviews.author: Paul Crawley

customer_reviews.title: Works in an instant!
customer_reviews.text: We had an original Keurig when they first came out. That one lasted for a long time. Then we had to replace it with one that quit after about a year and then the next one was giving us the same difficulties within the same time frame. We decided to try this Cuisinart based on all the reviews.We are thrilled ! It starts brewing almost instantaneously. No waiting for warm up and hearing the machine straining and straining. The coffee is good and hot. There are several variety of sizes. We have had it for about 45 days and we are happy and hopeful that we will have it for many years.
customer_reviews.author: bella

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: We have had MANY coffee makers over the years and this is my new favorite... Accepts ALL K-cups and basically just WORKS - every time... Seems like a low bar, but we have had Keurigs and Touch Plus (avoid at all costs), that just cannot get the job done on a regular basis (too many defects to mention here)... If you are looking for a great value in K-cup coffee, this is it... As others here have mentioned, the build quality is "cheapish", but for the price, you really can't do better... That's been my experience, and I would highly recommend this unit to anyone and everyone...
customer_reviews.author: Steve L

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Bye, Bye Keurig. Nice knowing ya Keurig. Out to the garbage, the Keurig 2.0 went. I am so happy we found this coffee maker. Quite and makes better java than the other junk (Not mentioning that name ever again.) This is the one. I have my own coffee that I grind. The wire baskets are a bit larger than the other junk, (Not mentioning that name ever again.) The larger wire basket allows for much stronger coffee. Lost power for 2 hours one day. When the electricity was restored it kept all the settings.
customer_reviews.author: AllAboutIdaho

customer_reviews.title: Coffe grounds in cup constantly
customer_reviews.text: Have had this cuisinart for a year. Worked fine until a month ago. Coffee grounds in cup. Cleaned both puncture needles thoroughly. This did no good at all. Absolutely nothing resolves the issue. I would not recommend this SS10 machine. After posting this review, I called Cuisinart customer service to complain, not thinking anything could be done. I explained what was happening. Not only was customer service very apologetic, but they decided it must be a defect and they are sending a new coffeemaker to replace mine. All I need to do is send my defective one back with a prepaid shipping label. I have to give them a shout out for handling my case!!! They were awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Sue E

customer_reviews.title: I drew so much house current that the lights blinked while brewing ... scarely .. Returned it.
customer_reviews.text: After having Keurig coffee maker for 5 yrs, I got spoiled with good coffee but it broke so I bought Cuisinart. When we brewed it, our house lights started to blink and I thought we are going to lose electricity from cold weather. It didn't go off. But we noticed that the lights blinked every time when brewing. I knew the kitchen where the Cuisinart was and the living room lights were all connected ant the circuitry was overloaded because of the coffee maker. This never happened with my "small business" Keurig coffee maker. So, I got scared and returned it the next day. Also, coffee didn't taste as well as Keurig's so I bought it again.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this a little over 3 years ago to replace a Keurig that I had bought for our new home, to only find out the keurig will only use the keurig k cups with the special barcode on them. I enjoy a certain brand of coffee that comes in compostable k cups and the fact was I couldn’t use them with the keurig. I ordered this work horse to replace it and haven’t looked back. This brews a perfect cup everytime. This coffee maker takes abuse and keeps coming back for more. I never in my life would think I’d say I love my coffee maker, but I do!
customer_reviews.author: L. Post

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love the Cuisinart single cup. This is my second one The original use to have a blue light in the water chamber, I suppose because too many people biatched about it they did away with it. I agree with others about the pump being loud. No deal breaker though it does vibtlrate the heck out of the metal piece on the cup rest tray. More annoying than anything. I've tried putting different things under the maker to get it to stop but to no avail. Besides that, it works very well..always ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffeemaker. Had purchased 6 Keurigs from Costco
customer_reviews.text: Excellent coffeemaker. Had purchased 6 Keurigs from Costco. They would break after 1-2 weeks of use. I haven’t had any issues with this maker (knock on wood). Highly recommend getting one. It’s smaller than the Keurig 2.0 model. Looks like better quality than the Keurig model. Works quicker and faster than the Keurig: turn Keurig on. Wait for the water to brew, then it finally brews and you get less than 12 oz of coffee. Cuisinart model: turn it on. Close the lid. Brews a little over 12 oz of coffee. And the coffee is hot vs luke warm. Great investment for this coffee drinker! Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: David Michael Rapp

customer_reviews.title: Just buy the industry leader...
customer_reviews.text: This is just too lightweight to handle the processing it does. The machine, the counter and the room vibrates. I could hear it at the opposite end of the house. I think a sturdy counter that doesn't vibrate make the sound louder. It also doesn't fully empty the K-cup so it dribbles when you remove it. I gave it as much time as I could to get used to it but I just gave up and repurchased a Keurig. All machines make some noise but the vibrating and dribbling coffee were just to much to adjust to.
customer_reviews.author: vj2400

customer_reviews.title: Junk-Manufacturer, warranty company and Amazon are all NO help.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this coffee maker through Amazon and also purchased a protection plan from Asurion. Fast forward 9 months and pump is not working correctly and the Descale indicator will not go off even after 4 descale cycles. We have tried filing a claim with Asurion 3 times and each time get told to file a claim with the manufacturer. We tried filing a claim with Cuisinart and their site just keeps making you register the product-it will not allow a claim to be files. Amazon wil also of no help. Awful from all angles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOUD, MESSY, CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: Was really looking forward to this machine. I've used Keurig before but liked the style of this machine and well it's Cuisinart. What a huge disappointment from the first use. The machine is LOUD!! You can hear clear across in another room :( The lid is cheaply made and fingerprints are visible . The liquid sputters out from the beginning. I've usually seen machines do this at the very end but this one does it throughout. Sputtering equals coffee sprinkled all over the machine. So if you don't mind a loud cheaply made machine that requires cleaning with every use then this is the machine for you 🤷🏻‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Yvette

customer_reviews.title: Will not purchase another one.
customer_reviews.text: I have always had Cuisinart brewers. But this one has changed my mind. I will try a keurig now. This brewer is impossible to descale. Now it only goes a month until the descale comes on. Which is odd to me because I use only distilled water. I just did two descale, one with the concentrate, one with the white vinegar. Both times it sat on for half an hour before rinsing with distilled water. Then unplugged for hours. Last time I called customer service. Their only advice, unplug. Couldn’t offer any other help. So in a nutshell, this brewer is junk. Don’t waste our money.
customer_reviews.author: Ssw

customer_reviews.title: Loud, clunky, and Meh...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is far from "premium." Only someone with a loose relationship with the truth from Cuisinart's marketing department would have the chutzpah to give it that label. It's mostly plastic (and not the good kind of sturdy plastic either), its operation is clunky, and it's LOUD—like "This can't be right. There's no way they released a coffee maker this loud" loud. The coffee the machine makes is nothing to write home about. I just dug out an old Keurig we had saved from years ago, and I'll use that going forward.
customer_reviews.author: John Greco

customer_reviews.title: Not what I had hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item after my Cuisinart SS-700 started running slowly. I had it for quite a few years, and LOVED it. Since my original coffee maker has been discontinued, I decided to choose this lower-cost option rather than to purchase the SS-780, which would have been more closely related to my former machine. I must say I'm very disappointed. This unit is slow, and loud. I really should have just kept my other coffee maker. Or, I should have spent the extra money and gotten the better one. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: HoneyBee

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this coffee maker to replace a Keurig that finally gave up the ghost. This one is superior. It is especially nice that the heating elements are ready within seconds. The only slight "con" is that it spits a little. I really like all the other features though, including being able to make several smaller or larger cup sizes, the plain hot water option, and the rinse feature. It comes with its own custom pod as well for ground coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Customer

customer_reviews.title: Run away.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Cuisinart SS-10 Premium Single-Serve Coffeemaker. Twice. Shame on me, right? I received the first coffee maker in a timely fashion. Removed it from the box & for a solid hour, I tried to run the 'setup.' Unless the machine is setup successfully, it will not function & won't make coffee. I kept getting what I call an, 'Add Water Error.' Okay, anyone can get a lemon, right? So, I returned it & ordered a replacement. Well, the replacement flashed the same 'Add Water Error' &, I could not run the setup. We're returning the 2nd coffee maker today. I am done. Further researched revealed problems w/this model's water pump. Shopping around for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Punychick

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: At first we really liked this coffee maker. We liked several features... it was not as tall as our previous brand of k-cup coffee maker... therefore it fits well under our kitchen counter. We especially liked the option to set an ounce size for the coffee and a temperature setting for the water. However, after using it for under 3 months, we have found that it brews very slowly. And even though we have it set on the “very hot” setting, the coffee is not hot. We are very disappointed and would return it if we could. However, since we are past our return date, we will be keeping it. We would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: THE BIGGEST WATER RESERVOIR!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we have purchased. Our previous one lasted 10 years. It finally wouldn't heat the water hot enough, so we got a new one. Although it is slightly different than the old one, it has the biggest water reservoir of any we have seen. It isn't gigantic on the counter, though - nice and compact. Love how easy it is to remove and refill the water container. Brews quickly, and can accommodates a taller travel coffee thermos.
customer_reviews.author: jumpannejump

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing product
customer_reviews.text: After going through 2 different Keurig's in 2 years, wanted to try a different brand. This one looks nice, but the coffee is warm meaning within a minute of leaving the cup it needs to go into the microwave. The top spring loader is ripe to break. Poor design there. Very disappointed and will be off in search of a better K-Cup coffee maker that can handle making 2 cups of hot coffee every day. Doesn't seem like that is too much to ask but it has proven to be a challenge...
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite single coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffeemaker. I've had Kuerig, Bunn, Senseo, this is by far my favorite. Love the large water container so it's ready to use. I set it on a timer so it's always on and ready. Love all the settings like cup sizes so I can have a cup or fill up my travel mug. It has a hidden compartment that holds the attachment to use coffee grounds instead of kcups. The only time it splashes is when you use the hot water but it's just water so it's easy to wipe up. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Pixie

customer_reviews.title: Brews very slowly
customer_reviews.text: I had I previous model of this machine and I loved it. When it stopped working after many years I wanted the same machine so I ordered this one. I’m so disappointed. This one takes forever to push the water through regardless of the settings. And now it’s only making half cups. I’ve cleaned it and followed all the troubleshooting tips and still every third cup of coffee is only half of what it should be. It’s quite frustrating consyhow much this item costs. I expected more from Cuisinart
customer_reviews.author: Sme1969

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and reliable and fast heating
customer_reviews.text: I know this is the "older" version but I bought the new one and hated it. Felt like cheap plastic so I returned it. We have this model at work and I had been using it so bought it for myself. Solid, sturdy. Initial heating up is pretty fast. I run a 12 and 4 oz cup thru one Dunkin Donuts decaf pod and I don't have to wait in between. Before I bought this one I used someone's Keurig 2.0 at work and it took FOREVER for the initial heat up
customer_reviews.author: Cathleen C.

customer_reviews.title: BROKE AFTER TENTH USE.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee maker after I had read negative reviews about Keurigs breaking down so quickly. Everyone in my family owns a Keurig and they have always worked great, but I still decided to buy a Cuisinart. From day one it was very loud when it brewed. Today, I got an EEO code. The only info given about it in the instruction manual is to call customer service. I am very frustrated. I had only brewed one box of coffee, 10 pods! Too late to call CS. I will have to wait until the morning to find out what is wrong.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer leigh

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality, returned it. Look at other makes and models instead.
customer_reviews.text: I had the SS700 model previously and hoped this newer model would be similar. Sadly it isn't. No metal parts like 700 model, not sure why they include stainless steel in the product description. Right out of the box the open/close sensor switch sticks/malfunctions so unit doesn't know if pod area open or not, frustrating. I realize that there can be faulty units with any brand product but overall it did not have a quality feel and fit.Returned it without brewing even one cup. Bought the K-Elite model and pleased with it so far. It's more like the SS700 for sure.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS COFFEE MAKER
customer_reviews.text: Great machine! My top favorite features are - Easy to use, small size (fits in our pantry shelf), fast!- ready and super hot in seconds, accurate cup sizes for brewing, pretty quiet (compared to old keurig), and pretty sleek looking (silver model). Its also easy to clean and fill the water tank and has a filter option, which is nice. I don’t really have anything negative to say about it except maybe the lid for the k cup compartment is a little tough to open/close but seems to be getting easier the more we use it. Million times better than our old k machine
customer_reviews.author: Nikki B

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I don’t drink much coffee so this works perfectly for me. It’s quick, easy and produces a very nice cup of coffee. I like my coffee super hot and this machine provides that. It is easy to clean and looks really nice sitting on my counter top. Besides providing a really hot cup of coffee, my second favorite feature is the large water reservoir. May sound silly, but I like that I can fill it and it lasts for a few days-makes for a quick cup of coffee. We have a Keurig at work and it has to pre heat before brewing the coffe-the Cuisinart starts brewing instantly. This is a great coffeemaker and well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 8 months.
customer_reviews.text: The problems I can live with: Interface buttons are counter intuitive and poorly thought out. The machine likes to "spit" making constant cleanup of the front of the unit necessary. The top mechanism feels flimsy and cheap. It's much louder than I thought it should be. The problem I can't live with: Even with regular cleaning with vinegar and dedicated solutions, one day the pump started sounding different and a month later it stopped working all together. For some reason I had the impression that Cuisinart was quality and really its far from it. I went to target and replaced it with a Keurig K-Elite.
customer_reviews.author: Moebium

customer_reviews.title: Worked 3 months!!  Poor Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED: Now I say ZERO STARS. it has been 5 WEEKS since I had to fill out replacement info for Conair ( the company that makes this). I still do not have my new coffee pot. I had it for 3 MONTHS before it just stopped working with error messages!!! DO NOT BUY THIS. Had a Keurig for 8 years - but got this upgraded new model for my birthday. Worked 3 months before error messages and it stopped working. Customer service is replacing it- but it’s been 3 weeks and still no replacement. I could get one in 2 days from Amazon- so I’m not impressed
customer_reviews.author: Michele H

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I retired a Nexpresso Vertuoline because although the foamy crema is nice, the $2.00 per cup for the premium coffee isn't and I have found that the coffee just doesn't taste like it used to. You can't buy other brands for the Nespresso either. So, I went off to find a K-Cup coffee maker that will handle the Peet's K-Cups. This one is great because it brews a SUPER hot cup of coffee and has adjustable portion sizes. So, if you find your K-Cup is too weak, make a smaller cup. The hot water will help brew a better cup too. Happy caffeinating.
customer_reviews.author: Norm de Ploom

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best k-cup coffee maker we have purchased! It holds a lot of water so you don't have to refill it as often as other k-cup coffee makers and the variety of cup sizes to choose from is a great option! Not sure why other reviews have said it is messy and splashes; that hasn't been an issue for us, neither has the noise. The noise it makes while brewing is minimal and quick! The overall look of the product is beautiful and sleek. Looks great in our kitchen! Highly recommend. You won't be disappointed. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: vic

customer_reviews.title: OLD MODEL BETTER, BUT THIS ONE IS OKAY
customer_reviews.text: After five year to old one gave out. This new model is not as user friendly as the older model. First problem is the tank. There is not a convenient way to grip and remove or replace as the older model has. The K-Cup holder is cumbersome compared to the older model. The unit works fine so far, yet I wonder why the engineers didn't make it as user friendly as previous issues.
customer_reviews.author: Zacke

customer_reviews.title: Does not brew hot enough, therefore coffee is weak.  Returning...
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement for Keurig 2.0 brewer that had to be cleaned continually. The Cuisinart simply does not brew hot enough. Coffee is weak and pods like hot chocolate are not emptied, leaving most of the product in pod. Brewer looks nice and we liked the basic operation but when the end result has to go straight into microwave, sort of defeats everything else. Sending back and went back to "classic" Keurig K55. No bells and whistles, was $50 vs $150 and brew is hot.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie P.

customer_reviews.title: If You Like Watery Coffee...
customer_reviews.text: My old Cuisinart coffee maker crapped out on me so I decided to stay with the same brand. I was interested in the freshness of a sing-serve coffee maker with ability to use your own coffee (K-cups are a scam). I tried this coffee maker for two weeks and had to return it. The coffee tasted awful. It was watered down to the point it was almost undrinkable. I tried making it several different ways and had family members taste test for me as well and they agreed it was exceptionally watery coffee. I'm disappointed because Cuisinart products are typically fantastic. This one I couldn't wait to send back.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Nicole

customer_reviews.title: This SS-10 isn't even close to the Quisinart SS-700!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my Quisinart SS-700 of 6+ years, that was still working BTW. Needless to say I think I'm going to return this cheap Keurig in Quisinart clothing and get my old SS-700 back on the countertop. The new SS-10 is all plastic, light weight, chintzy feeling and noisy vs. the SS-700. I can not compare it to a Keurig brand, but I don't like it. The only positive is that the coffee does taste good.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for older model
customer_reviews.text: No warm up required. Smaller. Less parts. Previous model lasted three plus years. One particular improvement is there is no longer a purge of the boiler back to the water tank which allowed lime build up to clog the tank outlet. Been using it for a couple of months and love it so far. 8 months later this happened and put off a terrible odor. I'm switching back to the Bunn coffee maker I still have in storage.
customer_reviews.author: DIY and Gadgets

customer_reviews.title: Trust me - just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Why would anyone buy a different single cup coffee maker? I have NO idea. I have owned 3 Keurig coffee makers in 10 years and have needed to replace each one. This last time I decided that they had three strikes and were definitely out. The Cuisinart is head, shoulders, antlers, and halos above the Keurig machines. High capacity, quick, easy to use, classy ... the list goes on! Treat yourself; I don’t think you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: C. Grant

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was fairly fast, and the brewer is of great quality! The water temperature is hot, hot, hot! No more lukewarm coffee! Brew takes about 45 seconds, and the added features make this a great substitution for the Keurig brand. All of my previous brewers were Keurig, so this one is a bit out of my norm, but the Keurigs seem to fail after about 18 months of use, even with proper maintenance, so I needed to reach out and try something different. So far so good! If it fails at 18 months, I will still feel like I am ahead because the cost of this brewer is about 1/2 the price of my Keurig brewers.
customer_reviews.author: denali1973

customer_reviews.title: Quit working just after a month!
customer_reviews.text: We liked the coffee maker but it quit working after a month. Trying to get help with returning the unit. Cuisinart does not back their products even though they are still under warranty. It was good tasting coffee, nice and hot, and it was also quick. But I can not recommend this product. It is kind of noisy and it does splash on the back of the machine. Update: Amazon came through and refunded our money. Thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: SHARON T

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t work!
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to use this new coffee machine. I was on my 3rd keurig so wanted to try something new. I followed the instructions for the initial set up; however the screen kept saying “not ready add water”. After trying for hours I realized it was not sensing that I had the water tank on the machine. I returned it for a different one thinking the 2nd one would work. When that one arrived it did the same thing! I don’t know if I am the only one with this problem, but needless to say I ended up returning it again for a different brand. Was so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Smar T. Pants

customer_reviews.title: In love with my cups of home brewed coffee!!
customer_reviews.text: I love my purchase! Was a bit hesitant after trying another brand but, I’m glad I made the decision to try this one! I love the water filter design, my coffee temperature is nice and scalding hot ( but you can adjust the temperature if your not looking for hot hot coffee) the hot water feature is awesome for my tea, and the rinse feature makes an easy cleanup!!! The coffee brews fast but great quality taste even if I make a second cup right after for my husband! I have absolutely no complaints and have been using faithfully daily for the past few weeks! If there’s any updates I’ll be sure to post !
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I'm nothing but, pleased with this coffee maker. 5-stars for all categories. I purchased this to compliment my old Cuisinart whole/pot coffee maker w/coffee bean hopper/grinder, that I've owned for over a decade. I just wanted to have one that makes single cups instead of a whole pot. This new one is so convenient and makes amazing coffee with the option to use the reusable K-cup with some gourmet coffee or purchase my favorite Starbucks K-cups. I loved my old Cuisinart coffee maker but, I'll probably never use it again because this maker is so good and convenient that I'm torn up inside over the decision to possibly throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: beats keurig
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Cuisinart with hopes that it would be better than all of the previous Keurig makers I have purchased in the past. I purchased a Keurig maker every two or so years because they kept breaking down on me and it seems to me that they know that the warranty is only good for a year and they make a not so good appliance to keep you coming back to buy another one. Well no more. I have given up on Keurig and bought this Cuisinart single serve coffee maker and boy am I glad I did. It is far more superior to me. And it comes with a three year warranty! Good job Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: RUSTY HOGLAND

customer_reviews.title: Nice single serve coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is easy to use. You can also use your own coffee thanks to a filter that is stored nicely in the side of the coffee maker. Easy to fill and operate. The only thing that we are disappointed in is the extra hot water feature. The water doesn't seem extra hot. But, we are still enjoying the convenience of this single serve coffee maker as one cup is usually all we need.
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding single-serve coffee maker!!
customer_reviews.text: After traveling for a month, using Keurig coffee makers in most hotel rooms, I decided to switch to a single-serve coffee maker to reduce waste. This Cuisinart SS-10P1 Premium Single-Serve Coffeemaker was a great looking option. I kept reading that a Keurig usually lasts a year or less. I have always had good luck with Cuisinart products, so I purchased this instead. it works flawlessly, both with K-cups and with the reusable coffee module that comes with it. The coffee is great tasting. It does not splatter like some of the reviews said. I love it. Buy one. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: W. Peters

customer_reviews.title: I am so glad I did
customer_reviews.text: after several kuerig's that lasted about a year each I decided to try this product. I am so glad I did! Not only do I not have to add water every time I make a cup of coffee, I can now set it for a 10 oz cup and the coffee taste much better! it is wonderful to set it for hotter cup as well! Purchase well worth it for me! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Cuisinart Coffee Maker. The first one is 10 years old and still working. Just wanted to have one at the office so I purchased a new one in July 2018. Here we are less than a year later and the plastic housing is discoloring due to the steam. To get a new one, remember this one is less than a year old they want me to pay shipping of $10.00 to get the new one and then to pay to ship the old one back to them. Terrible customer service and they have cheaped the product. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: vickie

customer_reviews.title: Blows away my Keurig Machine
customer_reviews.text: I wore my old Keurig out. I replaced it with this Cuisinart. The features are pretty much the same, but the differences are very notable. First, it brews my coffee at the perfect temperature. It is at that exact temperature that if it were any hotter it would scald my tongue. Second, it heats instantly and silently. The days of waiting for the machine to heat the water are over. I turn it on, put my pod in, and brew my coffee. It is that simple. I heartily recommend this machine to any who are looking for a great coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Mo

customer_reviews.title: SOOOOOO happy!
customer_reviews.text: I finally ditched Kurig Brand because I found myself having to buy a new one around Christmas EVERY year. I did a lot of research and chose this little gem. I absolutely love it. It looks great on the counter, it is SO easy to use and just seems much cleaner. It’s fast, and if you choose a different size oz. cup, you can actually see AND taste the difference! I am very happy with this coffee maker and I absolutely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: brookie

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee maker in Sept 2018. This week it started displays big “EEO”. The manual says if this code appears call customer support. On hold for 30 minutes and finally decided to do what the recording kept suggesting - send an email and the will respond within 24 hours. Three days later - nothing. Supposed to have a 3 year warranty - worthless if they don’t respond. Gettung another machine but NOT But not from this company!
customer_reviews.author: KayC68

customer_reviews.title: Nice assortment of features, but beware of splashing while brewing
customer_reviews.text: I really like the additional options this single serve offers such as the “hot water” and “rinse” mode. I drink a lot of teas and hit chocolate in addition to coffee. That is really what sold this coffee maker for me, plus I have been happy with other the other cuisinart appliances I have. The biggest thing I don’t like about this coffee maker is it splashes everywhere as it brews the coffee. So it gets on the back wall of the machine and sometimes on the counter. It doesn’t brew in one consistent stream, it spatter drips so that causes all the splashing.
customer_reviews.author: Aimée Mesko

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use, coffee tastes amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! I’ve been a keurig user since they came out. As time has gone by, I am constantly seeing the different ones, so thought I’d give it a try. It’s amazing with all the features of the keurig, but about half the price! It does more Han my keurig did! I can plug it in and not have to wait for the water to warm. I can make a cup immediately! I really like that feature
customer_reviews.author: Rachel E

customer_reviews.title: Kaput in 25 days flat
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on Jul 27, 2020. Used it for 4-5 times a day. Got "E E0" message on the display today (Aug 21, 2020) when trying to brew a cup. Called customer service per instruction in the manual and was told the unit has to be completely replaced but there is no ETA since the item is out of stock. So, voila -- no coffee maker for unknown amount of time. Had to go buy a whole new one and nope, it won't be Cuisinart for sure.
customer_reviews.author: EdySL

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great cup or mug of coffee
customer_reviews.text: On/Off button on side of machine vs front. A bit inconvenient. Water tank hold more than previously owned Keurig. Love the charcoal filter which needs changing every 60 uses/days. Not difficult. We have an inline filter to the water we consume, but this added feature makes the water as clear as crystal in appearance & drinks taste as they should without any additives. Several choices of size of each brew. My husband likes the 8 oz cup of coffee & I prefer the 12 oz. Also can adjust the temperature of cups - very hot of not so hot.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Jorden

customer_reviews.title: So much better than a Keurig!
customer_reviews.text: After needing to replace our 6th Keurig machine in 4 years we decided enough was enough and looked at other brands. We still like the convenience and selection of K cups so we looked at machines that used them. Found this Cuisinart on Amazon and it looked like exactly what we were looking for...and it was. It is incredibly fast, very, very quiet and has more features than a Keurig. You can brew more coffee cup sizes, it has an easy adapter for loose coffee included, it holds much more water so it doesn't need refilling as often. Time will tell on reliability but we've had good experience from other Cuisinart products. Lesson learned...don't buy a Keurig machine.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Flechsig

customer_reviews.title: Great, so far.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for four days, so will update If the product heads south. 🤢 I'm very happy with it at this point. Very easy to program. I love the fact that you can program the water size you want, because my preference is less than the way to coffee maker is programmed when you get it. I like strong coffee! You can make everything from a 4-oz to a 12 oz cup. That's great because most of my friends like their coffee weaker than I do. That's the advantage of a 1 cup Brewer!
customer_reviews.author: L. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't dispense the proper amount of water
customer_reviews.text: This was our second purchase of this item. This new maker is not calibrated properly and releases 2 ounces more water per 8 oz serving, resulting in weaker coffee. I compensate by making two 6 ounce cups and a 4 ounce cups with a new pod, splitting the 4 ounces between the 2 cups...a little hassle, but delicious coffee. The first coffee maker only lasted 18 months, no better than the Kuerigs we've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker!
customer_reviews.text: Received our brewer in 1 day! We hve had several Keurig coffee makers. Comparitively speaking, they are very expensive and do not last long. Our $250 machine lasted about 2 years then started leaking. We have another Cuisinart machine with a carafe, but we find it to large. This machine is a little smaller that the Keurig it is replacing. Very satisfied with the machine. The only thing I would mention is that it doesn't have a "AM" indicator. Just a PM indicator.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had mine for several months now and love it! Coffee brews nice and quick. I don’t use the reusable k-cup it came with, instead I bought a 4 pack on Amazon that just pop in and I love them. I use the hot water to make hot cocoa and oatmeal all the time and there’s never coffee left in it. I used to buy cheap coffee makers that would last 6-12 months and with all the reviews saying this brand lasts 4-6 years I’ll definitely be saving money! Worth the splurge in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as original model
customer_reviews.text: I use a k-cup machine every weekday and this is my 4th machine, 3rd Cuisnart. I like the original model much better. The lift mechanism (to open head) is more clumsy than original and the design is not as nice; looks cheaper. Biggest difference is that they no longer have blue LED lights in reservoir. This was useful because you could instantly see water level plus they looked cool. It is also more noisy. These are better than the Keurig branded machine but I wish someone would make a higher quality unit with better finishes which I'd gladly pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Klein

customer_reviews.title: This machine sucks!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have always purchased Cuisinart coffee makers. Eventually, for reasons I will never understand, it takes forever to brew a cup of coffee and not a full cup so I buy a new one. This model is a joke. It sounds like a lawn mower and has taken forever to brew a cup since day one. It spatters coffee everywhere and there are always grounds in my finished coffee. Coffee is half cold by the time it is finished brewing. I would return this in a heartbeat but immediately threw away the packaging I was so confident in this product. I would replace it with a Kurig if I could afford it.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce E Harmon

customer_reviews.title: A very good single serve coffeemaker that could use a design tweak
customer_reviews.text: Attractive unit, easy to program and to use, makes good coffee. My favorite of three different brands I've owned. Would rate five stars except for the lid of the of the K-cup compartment. It's a shiny silver plastic that is a fingerprint magnet. If that would bother you, plan on wiping it off every time you use the appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Sare

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: We love Cuisinart producrs, have several appliances, all great quality and durable. This coffee maker looks nice, has great features, brews good coffee instantaneously, everything fine. However, it feels cheap, the top plastic covers for the water container and top cover vibrate and make so much noise as if the whole machine would fall apart. For us so bad that it is a deal killer. When pressing the components to prevent the annoyance its fine. Not sure why Cuisinart could allow such a poor execution. Definitely sending it back. I have never given a product a single star. If it was some no name brand would have given 3 stars, but being a Cuisinart this is not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Aubie

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine.
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. I researched the kuerigs and a couple of other ‘pod’ coffee makers and decided the reviews overall were better on the Cuisinart. After asking several friends that owned Kuerigs, only 2 out of 10 still use theirs, they either broke after about a year or they just thought it too much trouble. This Cuisinart has been a great little machine, hot coffee, quick, nice size reservoir, etc.. Hope it isn’t disappointing after about a year... I will edit my review if it does!
customer_reviews.author: L.Honeycutt

customer_reviews.title: Nice coffee maker poor quality and reliability
customer_reviews.text: They replace two of them since May 2020 so although this is a nice coffee maker and works well at making coffee. The quality of the product is not so good. The first one after a month of use would not stop pumping water I had to unplug it to get it to stop. Now the second one today will not pump water consistently called manufactured they're replacing it for the second time what's an updated version we'll see how that goes.
customer_reviews.author: john staten

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Rules
customer_reviews.text: I had a smaller version of this unit for near 3 years, but it started to fail. So I opted to get this unit as a replacement. I read the reviews and made a choice. My one response to some reviews:. Turn down the heat/temp of the water to hot, not extra hot and the burnt flavor goes away. So far I like it as a whole, and better than the Keurig brand, as this unit can take all types and brands of cups.
customer_reviews.author: nevermore

customer_reviews.title: So far it seems to work as great as the original
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for our original Cuisinart Keurig that they stopped making. So far it seems to work as great as the original, but it is obvious that it is cheaper made from the moment you discover it is less than half the weight. Also even though they had the original to copy, they managed to put the cup size selection buttons in reverse order. Not a huge error, but totally counter intuitive and at least 4 times people have made themselves the wrong cup size. Less significantly the blue LEDs are gone from the water tank. Strictly cosmetic, but the blue water at night was attractive.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Better quality than last Keurig I bought
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Keurig products for about the 7-8 years; I have been through at least three of them and the last one was very cheaply made. I thought I would give the Cuisinart a chance and have been very pleased with it. I’ve been using for a couple of months now. The only complaint I have is that while it’s advertised for 12 ounces, and it will brew that amount, most 12 ounce tumblers will not fit underneath the coffee dispenser. I finally found one that does but it took some looking around. If you just brew into a cup/mug it should be no problem
customer_reviews.author: Jaye

customer_reviews.title: You will be glad you purchased this!
customer_reviews.text: My expensive Kuerig was replaced by this coffee pot. Fast, easy to use & attractive. You brew one cup and do not have to wait for the water to heat again to brew the second. Coffee is hotter. You can use it for just hot water, tea bags etc. The little side cavity where the KCup you can fill yourself is trick! I am hard on reviews but not this one. Exceeded expectations.👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: K Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, you won’t be sorry!!
customer_reviews.text: After reading tons of reviews on this machine and several other (including the kurig brand) I decided this machine was the best bang for the buck! I’ve had it for almost 2 months and I love it. Works great, easy to use and clean too! We use it for hot water and making tea, coffee, hot chocolate and even on the run cup a soups. If you’re looking for a reasonably priced and reliable machine for k cup use, you won’t be sorry with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Vukoson - Bugajski

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Loud and slow. I never understood companies that put out crappy products just to make a sale. When you put your name on something make sure it reprents quality. Charge us more if you have to but just make sure it works properly. Nothing was like my SS-700 model which they discontinued
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I got my 3rd Keurig in February. It was not made like the past 2 I had. The Keurig just wasn't making a good cup of coffee anymore and when the machine started to be loud and malfunction, Keurig sent a nasty email and wouldn't cover it. SO, I was on the search for a new Kcup brewer. I came across this one and am so glad that I did. It looks nice on the counter, is easy to use and makes a nice bold flavorful cup of java!! It may cost a bit more, but is worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: cw3

customer_reviews.title: It's a Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.text: The coffee maker is a Cuisinart! You can expect a quality product from the brand. It tends to run a little slower than other versions; however, it is dependable and makes an excellent cup. The temperature is adjustable but the initial setting is perfect! The coffee maker is sleek, clean and looks good on the counter. I am confident that it will provide years of service while maintaining the quality of the brew!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee but failed after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This was given as a holiday gift in Dec 2019 and up until today, has made really good coffee. Today it gave an error "EEO". Called customer service and was told to unplug it for an hour the plug it back in and rinse it out by pressing the rinse and hot buttons at the same time for 3 seconds. That failed and now it smells like burned electronics. Cuisinart is replacing it at no charge since it's within warranty. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Jim

customer_reviews.title: EEO error right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This Cuisinart SS-10 single serve coffeemaker did not work, right out of the box. As instructed, I set up the coffeemaker so that I could run the 'cleansing' brew. Immediately, the device displayed an 'EEO' error. I contacted Cuisinart customer service who suggested that I insure that the water reservoir was full and properly seated. When that did not work they suggested that I unplug the device for an hour so that 'the machine might reset itself'. That did not work either. When I called back to let them know that unplugging did not work, it was suggested that I return the item to the business that I purchased it from. Amazon graciously accepted it back.
customer_reviews.author: Lucido Bamonti

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: I love having the large water tank that this machine has. I fill it once a day and don;t have to worry about it after that. It proves a wide variety of cup sizes and the water is filtered though a convenient charcoal filter cartridge. It also has a hand rinse feature and a button for hot water for tea or other beverage. It tends to splash like other single cup makers, placing a teaspoon in the cup/mug under the drip eliminates that.
customer_reviews.author: Sebborn

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I’ve read a lot of reviews before I bought this coffeemaker. I was replacing a keurig coffee maker single serve. I really like that maker but it uses Vue cups and they are only sold by Keurig company and the cups just got to expensive. I like this coffee maker just as well and I can use K cups..
customer_reviews.author: cac

customer_reviews.title: Will not descale
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee maker... except it only lasts a few months. I've had several of these and none of them will descale. There is a descale indicator that comes on about 5 months into use. I've done monthly cleanings on the unit and again when the descale indicator comes on. The descale indicator has never gone out and the unit eventually stops working. I've followed the manufacturers recommendations every time and even use filtered water. The results are always the same. It just will not descale.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Ducellier

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Makes a larger cup of coffee than its predecessor. Has a smaller foot print than the previous model and It makes hotter beverages. Yes, it is a little louder that the previous one and it has more plastic parts but it works great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dobe

customer_reviews.title: EEO
customer_reviews.text: I was following the instructions to descale the machine and it went to a code EEO. The instructions said to call Cuisinart. Not open on Saturday so I checked several online recommendations and unplug and waited over an hour for the machine to reset itself. Others were not as successful as I was, but my machine started to work again. Glad I didn't have to return this five month old coffee machine.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Maffei

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Single-Serve Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: When I needed to purchase a new single-serve coffee pot, I researched several models and decided on the Cuisinart SS-10. We've had this pot a couple of weeks, and I'm happy with it. It makes the coffee very hot and is extremely quick to make the cup. Cleanup is easy. I read some reviews regarding how loud the coffee maker could be, but I've not noticed the volume of the process. I get a piping hot cup of coffee in about a minute. An excellent way to start my morning.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie from GA

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: So when this coffeemaker first came, it worked ok. I had to keep adjusting it so it wouldn't be so loud. After about 6 months it just sputtered so I cleaned it and it seemed to work ok, although slowly and pausing in the middle of a cup. Now it just spurts and sputters and spits out small amounts of water then gurgles and and growls. I'm so disappointed in this appliance. Will stick with Kurieg from now on since I had my last one over 7 years.
customer_reviews.author: lookin4seaglass

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite coffee maker EVER!
customer_reviews.text: When my Keurig died, I was not happy and thought I’d try another brand. Happened upon a reconditioned Cuisinart and fell in love. Holds more water, heats water faster and gives me hot water for tea. When that one died, I couldn’t find any more reconditioned units and then Cuisinart came out with an updated model which I promptly ordered and I’m so happy that they have this new model. It also has a smaller footprint on the counter than the Keurigs. I recommend this unit to everybody.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybug

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Machine!
customer_reviews.text: I have had 3 of the others coffee makers. All of them were slow brewing, easy to clog and horrible tasting coffee. This machine is awesome. It starts brewing as soon as you push the button. The coffee tastes great. It is also. A beautiful addition to my kitchen. The only drawback I have is, the small capacity of the water tank. I’ll take that, considering all these other advantages.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: You can't clean it properly--poor design
customer_reviews.text: So first, if you're expecting normal Cuisinart quality--forget it. All plastic and flimsy. I wish this were more expensive, but built better--like a real Cuisinart product. It makes better coffee than a Kuerig, i'll give it that. Here's the real problem--the way the water intake comes from the tank always leaves the oldest water left in the tank. I cannot empty, so the mold builds quickly. Then, you can't get to the mold except with a q-tip (which still does not work well). Just an idiotic design with mold that will to damage to your health
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Coffee maker that makes Excellent coffee.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for my husband's office. It was an earlier version of the Cuisinart Single-Serve K-Cup style coffee maker. He has told me that it was wonderful and made excellent coffee. As an aside, when I shopped for the first one I asked a Sales person to explain the differences in this K-cup style coffee maker. He explained about the filters and how they differed. His excellent advice prompted me to buy the original Cuisinart and I would choose nothing else when I purchased this one.
customer_reviews.author: Nanette G.

customer_reviews.title: Works with K-cups wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned after reading some of the other comments, but I have been using this Cuisinart coffee maker for over three months and have encountered no issues. Yes, it makes some noise when brewing, but it is a machine! I have had zero problems with my K-cup overflowing or not brewing correctly. I had Keurigs for over 10 years before switching. I tried and returned three Keurigs due to overflow and clogging. Keurig Customer Service blamed my water saying it was too soft. I tried different sources of water before giving up. Glad I switched as this Cuisinart is a workhorse with no problems!!
customer_reviews.author: Cheri A. Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Spews hot water and coffee grinds
customer_reviews.text: Just received this coffee maker. Took about a half-hour to set up, inserted a K-cup, and after about 15 seconds hot water and coffee grinds flew out of the top (and burned my arm). I cleaned up the mess and packed it up for return. I don't think that the K-cup seats properly.
customer_reviews.author: R. Paxton

customer_reviews.title: I love, love, love my new Cuisinart Coffeemaker!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffeemaker to replace our Keurig and I love it. My favorite feature is that the water is heated on demand. All I do is turn the coffeepot on and it’s ready to brew. No waiting for the water to heat up. The brew time is about the same as my Keurig or maybe a little faster. The water reservoir is larger so I don’t have to fill it so often. I also love the feature that allows me to choose what size cup I want because depending on the time of day, I may want a smaller or larger one. I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DLS

customer_reviews.title: it is pretty loud and " stainless steel" is a big stretch
customer_reviews.text: Very surprised at the lack of quality of this coffee maker. The water container arrived with a chipped rim. I am hoping to get only that replaced so I don't have to repackage the entire unit and return it. Also, it is pretty loud and " stainless steel" is a big stretch: plastic.
customer_reviews.author: G. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: This is fine but . . .
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old Cuisinart with this newer version. I like the old one better. It held more water and didn't have the weird flap on the top. That is a design flaw if you ask me. Every time I open it I feel like I'm going to break it off. What was the point of that little feature?? Anyway, it brews coffee pretty quickly, faster than the older model, but I wish it would hold more water. I WOULD RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: LoriAdamsBooks

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic versus previous version by Cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: My old Cuisinart died, so I went ahead and purchased this model to replace it. The older one had a solid metal head, and very sturdy construction. This model had a cheap plastic pop up lid for opening up the head for the k-cups, which after opening a couple times felt that it would easily break inside of 6 months. I decided to return it and find something that might not need to be replaced in 1 year. I would wish that Cuisinart would consider adding $10 to the price and using more durable materials, especially in the parts that are handled by the user.
customer_reviews.author: Royal OBrien

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go wrong
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome coffee maker. I’m a wee bit snobby about my coffee but didn’t want to spend a ton of money replacing the Jura I had. This makes a FAST cup of coffee - less than a minute and you never have to wait for the coffee maker to preheat - that alone makes this coffee maker worth it.
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Pilot

product_meta.title: Cuisinart SS-10P1 Premium Single-Serve Coffeemaker Coffemaker, 72 Oz, Silver
product_meta.description:
Color:SilverThe Cuisinart Premium Single-Serve Brewer offers freedom of choice! Choose 4, 6, 8, 10 or 12-ounce serving sizes, choose the ideal temperature, and enjoy a cup of coffee, tea, soup, or cocoa. This brewer is K-Cup compatible and also includes a HomeBarista Reusable Filter Cup for your favorite brew. The drip tray pulls out to accommodate travel mugs and the 72-ounce water reservoir eliminates the need for frequent refills! Refer instruction manual before use.The 72-oz. capacity Cuisinart Premium Single-Serve Brewer is a fully programmable and versatile home-brewing unit that is ideal for both personal use and entertaining, making it perfect for any household. Compatible with any brand of single cup pod including Keurig K-Cup pods and equipped with the HomeBarista™ Reusable Filter Cup, this coffeemaker makes it easier than ever for consumers to enjoy a wide array of hot beverages. The unit has five different cup-size settings (ranging from 4 ounces to 12 ounces), and an adjustable brewing temperature to ensure desired temperatures are reached. In addition to coffee, a hot water button can be used to prepare soup, tea, hot cocoa, and more, and the unit is equipped with a rinse function for easy cleaning. Features: K-Cup compatible brewer makes one cup at a time|5 beverage sizes: 4–12 oz.|Removable 72-ounce water reservoir|Hot water button lets you enjoy instant coffee soup tea and hot cocoa|Rinse feature instantly cleans the inside of the brew chamber|Fully programmable with a full spectrum of features including Auto On/Off and adjustable temperature control|Backlit blue LCD displays settings|Removable drip tray for travel mugs|Includes HomeBarista™ Reusable Filter Cup for ground coffee or tea|Charcoal water filter|Limited 3-year warranty|BPA free

BRAND STORY
